reviewer_full_det: Reviewer: helmut, 65-74 Male on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
review_comment: I took this in the hope that it would improve my energy level, which has been low despite the fact that I eat a very healthy diet and exercise vigorously every day. My blood pressure has historically been normal or on the low size. After several weeks of taking this drug my blood pressure and pulse skyrocketed to level 2 hypertension. I have stopped, and my blood pressure and pulse seem to be returning to normal levels. As such, I do not recommend this drug.

post_content: For several months I’ve been getting these severe itches all along my back, doctor thought it was eczema but the cortisone and other creams I was prescribed didnt really work. The itches are in groups of swollen lines along my back. They would go away when I exercise. Does anyone know what this may be? I have included a link for a picture of it. Thanks!  https://imgur.com/gallery/X1PyCCO
author: jzhang

post_title: Which is the best humidifier for winter?
post_content: Hello everyone know best humidifier for winter? plz Tell me!
author: Anonymous
response_text: Every winter, the air in your home and office is zapped of moisture, PureGuardian H4610 Cool Mist humidifiers that have some specific features that make them great for winter and give guidance on deciding which one is best for your home. Read more https://besthumidifierhub.com/best-humidifier-for-baby   Can't say which one is better, so I'm talking from my experience.  I used cool mist humidifiers for years but kept getting sinus infections. Turns out, the cool mist humidifier, even if cleaned thoroughly and regularly, still puts out mold and other irritants.  Switched to hot steam humidifier last year (no filters to clean or replace - just wash it out weekly with vinegar and water) and no sinus problems. We used to put pots of water on the radiators when I was a kid. Steam is the way to go; they are cheap, low maintenance, no mold or other hassles. Have a look at the comparison: https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/common-cold/expert-answers/cool-mist-humidifiers/faq-20058199 And also here's a separate guide on warm mists: https://houseweather.org/best-warm-mist-humidifier/

post_content: I'm severely allergic to corn (corn syrup, corn meal, corn starch, maltodextrin from corn, corn flour). Recently a 6 month detox program was recommended to me but I am concerned that one of the capsules I would have to take for 30 days contains corn silk. Should I avoid this product?
author: grannymimi
response_text: I am so sad to hear that. I think that maybe you should. I know that this is long past due but I recently discovered that I am possibly allergic to corn syrup so I am wondering how it went with you  Oh you should definitely avoid corn silk. I have been allergic to corn all my life and corn silk can cause an allergic reaction if you are not careful.

post_title: Good substitute for dust allergy medicine
post_content: Hi, I have Asthma and dust allergies, and as treatment I use three different medications on a daily basis. I take AllergyX as pills (1 every evening), Avamys as a nasal spray (Once before sleep), and Symbicort as an inhaler for my asthma (Once before sleep). I once switched from Zyllergy to AllergyX because I felt fatigue, and it helped. Is there any alternative for any of these thats considered better? Is there any problem with this combination of medications?
author: noisleahcim
response_text: I really sympathize with people have dust allergy because it seems to be everywhere. Your house must be always clean. My friend with the same problem even bought a special robot on https://cleanup.expert/robot-vacuums/ to get rid of dust fast and thoroughly

post_content: Hi ! all of a sudden i have red spots all over my skin similar to hives kinda itchy burny im worried its not bumps or anything smooth sorta like when you take a hot shower and you get red spots on thighs type my throat hurts a bit like swollen tight other than that i feel fine
author: priscilla198
response_text: I think it is worth going to the doctor  Hi. Personally I didn't have such red spots but my sister had these red spots. Everything was okay, because it was a kind of rash, although we thought it was something more grave. My mother and I were very worried about this, because we found an article https://www.medicinenet.com/red_spots_on_the_skin/symptoms.htm, where we read about benign tumors, allergic reactions, and all this scared us, but in the end we read there about the rash, and realized that it was a rash. I think that there you'll find a more accurate description of the symptoms you have, and depending on the symptoms, you'll know what's wrong with you.  Simon from https://triplumbing.com.au had a staff member with similar symptoms after a roofing job.  I think you should see a doctor for a checkup or you can read a topic on website https://iwthanoi.vn/ to find solutions
